channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Screams and Smoke’: How a Deadly Mass Shooting Unfolded in Sweden
item.description: The police responding to the attack encountered firing so intense that they struggled to tell how many gunmen were on the scene, an official said.

item.title: Humpback Whales Sing the Way Humans Speak
item.description: The animals’ complex songs share structural patterns with human language that may make them easier for whales to learn, a new study suggests.

item.title: Snap CEO Evan Spiegel mocks Mark Zuckerberg on LinkedIn—says he’s ‘VP Product’ at Meta because of all the features Facebook and Instagram have replicated from his app
item.description: Instagram has made its own versions of the stories and face filters pioneered by Snapchat.

item.title: Dozens of Clinical Trials Have Been Frozen in Response to Trump’s USAID Order
item.description: The stop-work order on U.S.A.I.D.-funded research has left thousands of people with experimental drugs and devices in their bodies, with no access to ...

item.title: In Greenland, the Ice Doesn’t Just Flow, It Quivers and Quakes
item.description: By using a fiber-optic cable to detect tiny vibrations a mile below the surface, scientists discovered a surprising way that ice sheets move.

item.title: Uber CEO says the company is ‘well-positioned’ on autonomous vehicles—but gains are still a long way off
item.description: Chief executive Dara Khosrowshahi said Uber was "well-positioned" as the autonomous-vehicle market heats up.

item.title: U.S. Waives Funding Freeze at Syria Camp Holding ISIS Fighters, but Future Is in Doubt
item.description: Upholding security at the camp in Syria is seen as critical to prevent a resurgence of the Islamic State, but contractors don’t know where they stand ...

item.title: Southern California Edison Found Irregularities on Equipment Where Eaton Fire Broke Out
item.description: Southern California Edison said video evidence had led it to look more broadly at whether its equipment might have been the cause of the deadly blaze.

item.title: Palmerston, the British Foreign Service Cat, Takes Up New Post in Bermuda
item.description: The cat, who first served in 2016, had feuded with Larry, the chief mouser at 10 Downing Street.

item.title: The person ruling on Elon Musk’s DOGE conflicts of interest is…Elon Musk
item.description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said Elon Musk will remove himself if overlap between DOGE and companies like SpaceX and Tesla arises.

item.title: Virginia McCaskey, 102, Owner and Stalwart of the Chicago Bears, Dies
item.description: The daughter of the Bears founder and football pioneer George Halas, she witnessed much of N.F.L. history from a young age, then took the team’s reins...

item.title: How Michael Kors owner Capri made a $675 million mistake by waiting in vain for a white knight
item.description: Meanwhile, Coach and Ralph Lauren continue to kill it.

item.title: Susan F. Wood, Who Quit F.D.A. Over Contraception Pill Delay, Dies at 66
item.description: She left the agency saying politics had slowed the approval of the morning-after pill for over-the-counter use. Her resignation drew national attentio...

item.title: Dozens of Clinical Trials Have Been Frozen in Response to Trump’s USAID Order
item.description: The stop-work order on U.S.A.I.D.-funded research has left thousands of people with experimental drugs and devices in their bodies, with no access to ...

item.title: A new bill would ban DeepSeek from government devices because hidden code reveals the AI app could send data to a Chinese telecom: ‘This should be a no-brainer’
item.description: DeepSeek had a sudden rise to popularity after it launched a powerful AI model that it said had been trained extremely cheaply.
